```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE,
                      warning = FALSE,
                      message = FALSE)

# Load Functions.
source("../../functions/myFunctions.R") 

# Load packages.
installMissingPackages(
  c(
    # Include statistical packages.
    "performance",
    "lmerTest",
    "lme4",
    "optimx",
    "MuMIn",
    # Include packages for tidy output.
    "tidyverse",
    "broomExtra",
    "sjPlot",
    "formattable",
    "knitr",
    "RColorBrewer",
    # Include packages for %in% %notin% syntactic notation
    "mefa4"
  )
)
```


```{r load corpus}
# Load Corpus
m_corpus <- get_m_corpus("../data/m_corpus.csv")  %>%
  # Select only columns for analysis
  select(
    speaker,
    gender,
    mode,
    prompt,
    acc_phon,
    fin_phon,
    h_t
  ) %>% 
  # keep only explicitly LH pitch accents.
  filter(acc_phon %notin% c("H*", ">H*")) %>%
  mutate(acc_phon = factor(acc_phon,
                           levels = c("L*H", "^[L*]H", "L*^[H]", "^[L*H]")))
```

```{r set equation}
my_equation = formula(
  h_t ~ mode * acc_phon +
    gender +
    fin_phon +
    (1 + mode + acc_phon | speaker) +
    (1 | prompt)
)

# model works with intercepts_only model
# Use same model for l_t

my_equation = formula(
  h_t ~ mode * acc_phon +
    gender +
    fin_phon +
    (1 | prompt) +
    (1 | speaker)
)
```

-   Singularity and convergence issues on initial model.
-   model works with intercepts_only model

```{r run initial model,  fig.height=3, fig.width=9}

# run model
h_t_model <-
  lmer(my_equation,
       data = m_corpus,
        control = lmerControl(
          optimizer = "bobyqa",
          calc.derivs = FALSE,
          optCtrl = list(
            method = "nlminb",
            starttests = FALSE,
            kkt = FALSE
          )
        )
      )

summariseLME(h_t_model, run_step=TRUE,
              write="../output_model_anovas/Mode_PA_h_t_anova.csv")

```

```{r random effect of prompt, fig.height=2, fig.width=5}
plot_model(h_t_model,
           type="re",
           axis.title = c("semitones", "prompt"),
           title="random effect: prompt",
           show.values = T)[2]
```

```{r make tidy model, fig.height=5, fig.width=7, results="asis"}

h_t_model.tidy <- analyseModel(h_t_model, write="../output/Mode_PA_h_t")
h_t_model.tidy$table


```

```{r do pairwise analysis}

charts <- getModelFixedFX(
  my_equation,
  m_corpus,
  write="../output/Mode_PA_h_t"
)
charts$intercepts
charts$slopes
```
